newsitem.title: INDIA: OPINION-WEEKLY TECHNICAL ANALYSIS OF BOMBAY SHARE INDEX.
newsitem.headline: OPINION-WEEKLY TECHNICAL ANALYSIS OF BOMBAY SHARE INDEX.

text.p: MINOR RECOVERY ON CARDS is a trend analysis of the
30-share Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) index for the period March 10 to March 14 by analyst Mehmood Khan at Times Guaranty Financials Ltd

Trading for the week ended on a cautious note, with a gain of 18.55 points (0.01 percent) at 3876.04 levels over the previous week. The market commenced the week on a strong note, but the higher levels (4029.56) could not be maintained due to off-loading of speculative postions.

At 4029.56 levels, the Sensex has corrected the decline of 1418.10 points (4131.22 to 2713.12) by 92.83 percent. Since the reactionary move has broken the vital resistance of 80 percent it has became eminent that the Major Bear Phase from 4643.31(top formed on September 12th 1994) has ended at 2713.12.

The mechanical indicators are on the verge of exhibiting a minor bottom formation on Monday/Tuesday that may be marginally higher than the 38.2 percent retracement of the rally from 4029.56 to 3316.71. The cluster of time logic support the bottom formation on March 10/11 1997. The corrective down move is two trading days old, may lose momentum on March 11, 1997, the target for the down-side can be placed at 3810-3765 levels.

The correctionary trend in Ashok Leyland, Asian, BSES, Grasim, ITC, L&T, SCICI, Siemen & Tata Chemicals are indicating losing momentum on the weekly chart. These counter may seek lower values in the initial half of the week, but may witness buying interest in due course and may probably close the week on a strong note. The best trading opportunity for the week's trading is to be on the long side from Tuesday with a stop-loss of 3742 levels.

The price following oscillators on the weekly bar chart are exhibiting that the bottom may be formed at 3810-3765 levels -Relative Strength Index (RSI) is 68.07 Price Rate of Change (ROC)is placed at 37.15, short term stochastic is hovering at 76.70 and its trigger line is at 64.56, while the medium term stochastic is 78.61 and the trigger is 74.09, the Macd is 86.43 and the tigger is 2.90 and the 14 Williams percent R is placed at -11.6. The mechancial oscillators justify that the minor correction from 4029.56 may lose momentum at 3810-3765 levels.

For the current week, the BSE Sensex may find support at 3805, 3792 and 3765 levels, on the higher end then it may encounter resistance at 1715 and 1742 levels. The National Index may witness buying interest at 1658-1615 levels and resistance at 1715 and 1742 levels.
(The opinions expressed in this article reflect the views of the author only. They should not be taken as reflecting the views of Reuters)
